creator: jstrachman@athenium.com
text:
I am trying to use the URL Rewriter.  It works just fine, except that for
whatever reason not all the pages in my app have the session ID in the HTML. 
Once it hits one of these pages, it "loses" the Session ID, and then sets it to
blank for the next request.  (This is because I am using the URL Rewriter
attached to the Threadgroup.)  

One option would be to add it manually prior to each request that needs it. 
However, this is extremely cumbersome, especially if you have made a large
script that contains many requests.  Also, this might not work in some cases.

I'd like to be able to submit a request, get the SessionID from the resulting
HTML, then store it in a variable and use that variable's value for the
SessionID wherever it occurs for the rest of the requests in the Threadgroup. 
In fact, I'm wondering whether the URL Rewriter should have worked this way in
the first place?

FYI, I found a way around this for my app, so unless anyone else needs this 
functionality, you might just want to mark it as WONTFIX.
creator: jstrachman@athenium.com

text:
I am trying to use JMeter for load test of a web application deployed in 
BroadVision. BroadVision tracks session id in the URL. I am trying to use "HTTP 
URL Re-writing Modifier" in JMeter. But, it does not work. It is not retaining 
the session ids for all the HTTP requests. I saw your mail in the jmeter bug 
list mentioning that you have found a work around for this. Can you please 
write me the work around for this. Your help is greatly appreciated.
creator: sonybals2002@yahoo.com
jstrachman@athenium.com
text:
The problem is that the sessionID must be in the HTML for all of your HTML
pages.  If there is one page or frame in your application that does not have it,
for instance a decorative frame, then it will "lose" the sessionID.  So, in
order to make this work, you will need to remove any frames from your test that
don't contain the sessionID.

It would be helpful to have the option of retaining the session id until it is 
set to a new value.  This would be helpful in testing the entire app as it is 
currently working rather than having to remove test elements that invalidate 
the session id.
creator: udele.malabanan@na.whiteclarkegroup.com
